column4: U.S. House defense bill funds 12 Boeing fighters  6 Lockheed F-35s
column5: WASHINGTON The U.S. House Armed Services Committee's fiscal 2016 defense bill includes $1.15 billion in extra funding for 12 additional Boeing Co Super Hornet combat jets and $1 billion for six Lockheed Martin Corp F-35 B-model fighters.

column4: REFILE-Saab dismisses prospect of Gripen jet fighters sale to Argentina
column5: LINKOPING  Sweden  April 27 Sweden's Saab AB  on Monday ruled out facilitating the sale of Gripen fighter aircraft to Argentina as the result of a deal to build and export combat jets from Brazil.

column4: U.S. House defense bill funds 12 Boeing fighters  6 Lockheed F-35s
column5: WASHINGTON  April 27 The U.S. House Armed Services Committee's fiscal 2016 defense bill includes $1.15 billion in extra funding for 12 additional Boeing Co  Super Hornet combat jets and $1 billion for six Lockheed Martin Corp F-35 B-model fighters.

column4: U.S. watchdog finds quality violations in Pratt work on F-35 engine
column5: WASHINGTON The Pentagon's internal watchdog on Monday said it found 61 violations of quality management rules and policies during an inspection of Pratt & Whitney's work on the F-35 fighter jet engine and warned the problems could lead to further cost increases and schedule delays on the biggest U.S. arms program.

column4: UPDATE 1-U.S. watchdog finds quality violations in Pratt work on F-35 engine

column4: Marathon Galveston Bay workers back leadership's rebuff of offer
column5: LA MARQUE  Texas More than 800 striking workers at Marathon Petroleum Corp's Galveston Bay Refinery voted on Sunday to back their leaders' rejection of a last  best and final offer from the company to end a three-month work stoppage.

column4: Fitch Upgrades Marsh & McLennan to 'A-'; Outlook Stable
column5: (The following statement was released by the rating agency) CHICAGO  April 27 (Fitch) Fitch Ratings has upgraded Marsh & McLennan Companies   Inc.'s (MMC) long-term Issuer Default Rating (IDR) and senior unsecured debt  ratings to 'A-' from 'BBB+'. Fitch has also affirmed MMC's short-term ratings at  'F2'. A full list of MMC's ratings follows at the end of this release. The  Rating Outlook is Stable. KEY RATING DRIVERS The ratings upgrade reflects MMC's continued trend of improved operating  per

column4: Medtronic to halt manufacture of pain drug pump: U.S. regulators
column5: Medtronic Plc has agreed to stop manufacturing and distributing its SynchroMed implantable drug pump  U.S. regulators said on Monday  a step toward resolving allegations that the company violated quality standards with the device which delivers pain medication to cancer patients and others.

column4: Medtronic to halt manufacture of pain drug pump -U.S. regulators

column4: Medtronic agrees to U.S. FDA consent decree on drug pump
column5: Medtronic Plc has agreed to resolve U.S. regulators' allegations it violated quality standards for making its SynchroMed implantable drug pump  which delivers medications to cancer patients and others with chronic pain.

column4: Medical device maker Medtronic reaches settlement with FDA
column5: April 27 Medical device maker Medtronic Plc  said it reached a settlement agreement with the U.S. Food and Drug Administration over one of the company's drug delivery systems.

column4: UPDATE 2-Merck diabetes drug Januvia meets heart safety target
column5: April 27 Merck and Co's diabetes drug Januvia achieved the main goal of a long-awaited heart safety study  according to preliminary results released by the drugmaker on Monday  likely removing a cloud of uncertainty from its biggest product.

column4: Merck's diabetes drug Januvia succeeds in heart safety trial

column4: Morgan Stanley fights claim by Home Shopping founder's widow: filing
column5: The widow of the Home Shopping Network's co-founder is seeking more than $170 million from Morgan Stanley in a case alleging  among other things  that the firm made excessive securities trades to boost commissions  according to a disclosure.

column5: * Uniper to start operations Jan. 1  2016   (Recasts  adds details)

column4: U.S. lawsuit over Nautilus fitness equipment heart monitors revived
column5: NEW YORK A lawsuit against fitness equipment maker Nautilus  Inc was revived on Monday  when a U.S. appeals court ruled that a heart rate monitoring patent the company is accused of infringing is valid.

column4: U.S. lawsuit over Nautilus fitness equipment heart monitors revived
column5: NEW YORK  April 27 A lawsuit against fitness equipment maker Nautilus  Inc was revived on Monday  when a U.S. appeals court ruled that a heart rate monitoring patent the company is accused of infringing is valid.

column4: UPDATE 3-Japan's Inpex wins 5 pct stake in new Abu Dhabi oil concession
column5: TOKYO/ABU DHABI  April 27 Japan's Inpex Corp  became the first Asian oil company to get a stake in a new 40-year onshore oil concession in Abu Dhabi  joining France's Total in developing the United Arab Emirates' (UAE) biggest oilfields.

column4: Investors challenge two-for-one vote regime at France's Orange
column5: PARIS  April 27 An investment management company is seeking to prevent French telecommunications company Orange shifting to a system where long-term investors get two votes per share rather than one  a move that has failed in other high-profile cases.

column4: BRIEF-Orkla expands Nordic partnership deal with PepsiCo
column5: * Orkla ASA has signed an agreement with PepsiCo to become the primary go-to-market partner for PepsiCo's juice  cereals  and snacks products in the Nordics  including the brands Tropicana  Quaker  and Lay's.

column4: Mylan says Teva offer too low; criticizes stock  growth prospects
column5: Mylan NV  rejected Teva Pharmaceutical Industries Ltd's  $40 billion takeover offer on Monday  saying in a scathing letter that it grossly undervalued the company and that Mylan has no interest in payment in what it termed "high-risk" Teva stock.

column4: UPDATE 1-PetroChina first-quarter profit dives 82 percent
column5: HONG KONG  April 27 PetroChina  China's biggest oil and gas producer  reported a sharper-than-expected 82 percent fall in first-quarter profit  due to lower international crude prices and inventory writedowns at its refining division.

column4: UPDATE 2-China plans mergers to cut number of big state firms to 40 - state media
column5: BEIJING  April 27 China will likely cut the number of its central government-owned conglomerates to 40 through a series of mergers  as Beijing pushes forward a plan to overhaul the country's underperforming state sector  state media reported on Monday.

column4: Sinopec  PetroChina dismiss media reports about merger
column5: HONG KONG  April 27 Sinopec Corp and PetroChina on Monday dismissed media reports their parents would merge to create a state giant  saying they have never received any official information about such a restructuring.

column4: PetroChina first-quarter profit dives 82 pct  below forecasts
column5: HONG KONG  April 27 PetroChina  China's biggest oil and gas producer  reported a sharper-than-expected 82 percent fall in first-quarter profit  due to lower international crude prices and inventory writedowns at its refining division.

column4: China stocks surge on state firm merger hopes
column5: SHANGHAI  April 27 China stocks jumped to fresh seven-year highs on Monday  led by heavyweights such as China Petroleum & Chemical Corp and PetroChina Co Ltd  on expectations that Beijing will accelerate mergers among state-owned enterprises (SOEs).

column4: CORRECTED-Petrobras says non-government board member Monforte resigns
column5: RIO DE JANEIRO  April 24 Jose GuimarÃ£es Monforte quit the board of directors of Petroleo Brasileiro SA  on Friday  and a source on the board said two days earlier he had abstained from voting to approve the company's audited financial statements.

column4: CORRECTED-Petrobras says non-government board member Monforte resigns
UPDATE 1-Precision Drilling profit beats estimates as costs fall
column5: April 27 Precision Drilling Corp   reported a better-than-expected quarterly profit as job cuts and other cost-cutting measures helped Canada's largest drilling contractor maintain margins despite a steep decline in drilling activities.

column4: Precision Drilling's quarterly profit drops by three-quarters
column5: April 27 Precision Drilling Corp    Canada's largest drilling contractor  reported a 76.3 percent drop in quarterly profit as weak oil prices curtailed activity in North America.

column4: BRIEF-Orkla expands Nordic partnership deal with PepsiCo
column5: * Orkla ASA has signed an agreement with PepsiCo to become the primary go-to-market partner for PepsiCo's juice  cereals  and snacks products in the Nordics  including the brands Tropicana  Quaker  and Lay's.

column4: UPDATE 2-Owner of Tim Hortons  Burger King posts strong 1st-qtr sales
column5: April 27 Restaurant Brands International Inc   said on Monday its Burger King and Tim Hortons chains posted their strongest same-store sales performance in years in the first quarter  with customers lured in by popular menu items.

column4: CANADA STOCKS-TSX rises slightly  led by mining stocks
column5: TORONTO  April 27 Canada's main stock index gained on Monday as buoyant metal prices helped mining stocks rise and investors cheered first-quarter results from Restaurant Brands International Inc.

column4: PEOPLE: Byrne leaving RBS for TD Securities: sources
column5: LONDON  April 27 (IFR) - Mark Byrne has resigned from the SSA syndicate desk at Royal Bank of Scotland and is expected to join the SSA desk at TD Securities  market sources told IFR on Monday.

column4: Smaller and simpler mantra rings through banking boardrooms
column5: LONDON Deutsche Bank's plan to jettison much of its German retail bank and withdraw from one in ten countries sees it join a growing list of banks choosing to shrink and simplify to survive.

column4: RBS sells further North American loan portfolio to Mizuho
column5: LONDON  April 27 Royal Bank of Scotland  has sold a further portfolio of North American loans to Mizuho   as it continues to sell off unwanted international assets to focus on domestic lending.

column4: BRIEF-Seadrill Partners Q1 cash distribution $0.5675  unchanged on Q4
column5: * Seadrill partners board of directors has declared a quarterly cash distribution with respect to quarter ended March 31  2015 of $0.5675 per unit  in line with the Q4 distribution.

column4: Statoil must move ahead with Snorre field expansion - govt
column5: OSLO  April 27 Norway's Statoil must move ahead with the delayed upgrade of the Snorre oil and gas field in the North Sea because it is a time-critical investment  energy minister Tord Lien said on Monday.

column4: Telefonica Brasil prices share offering for GVT purchase
column5: RIO DE JANEIRO  April 27 Telefonica Brasil SA  said on Monday its board had approved a share offering priced at 47 reais ($16.12) for preferred shares and 38.47 reais for commons shares  as the company raises funds to buy broadband provider GVT.

column4: AES says power storage business expanding into Europe  new U.S. markets
column5: LOS ANGELES  April 27 AES Corp unveiled plans on Monday to expand its energy storage business into Europe and in new U.S. markets as the power industry aims to boost the reliability of renewable energy.

column4: Conde Nast eyes digital viewers with virtual reality  scripted shows
column5: LOS ANGELES Privately held Conde Nast may best be known as the publisher of fashion  culture and lifestyle magazines such as Vogue  Vanity Fair and GQ  but it is hoping to draw new consumers and advertisers through the realm of virtual reality.

column5: April 27 ESPN sued Verizon Communications  on Monday for breach of contract involving a new pay-TV offering  as the cable sports network fired the latest volley in a mounting battle with the telecommunications company.
